skill.name: azure-deploy
skill.description: Execute deployment to Azure. Final step after preparation and validation. Runs azd up, azd deploy, or infrastructure provisioning commands. USE FOR: run azd up, run azd deploy, execute deployment, provision infrastructure, push to production, go live, ship it, deploy web app, deploy container app, deploy static site, deploy Azure Functions, bicep deploy, terraform apply. DO NOT USE FOR: creating or building apps (use azure-prepare), validating before deploy (use azure-validate).
skill.summary: Deploy applications to Azure using azd, Bicep, or Terraform. Requires prerequisite validation.
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate Microsoft Azure deployment skill. Static findings are false positives - all detections are documentation examples of Azure CLI commands, standard Azure project paths, Azure documentation URLs, and OIDC authentication patterns in CI/CD workflows. The skill includes proper safety guardrails requiring prerequisite validation and user confirmation for destructive actions.

content.value_statement: This skill automates Azure deployments using azd, Bicep, or Terraform. It ensures deployments only proceed after proper validation, reducing failed deployments and cloud costs.
actual_capabilities: Execute azd up or azd deploy commands to provision and deploy to Azure
Deploy infrastructure using Bicep templates with proper error handling
Deploy infrastructure using Terraform with state management
Verify deployment success by checking endpoints and resource status
Handle common deployment errors with documented remediation steps
Integrate with CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps
limitations: Requires azure-prepare skill to run first to generate the deployment plan
Requires azure-validate skill to run first and pass validation
Cannot modify the plan status to bypass validation checks
Does not create or build applications - only deploys pre-built artifacts

use_cases.title: Deploy web application to Azure
use_cases.description: Deploy a containerized web application to Azure Container Apps with a public endpoint
use_cases.target_user: Developers deploying web apps to Azure

use_cases.title: Provision infrastructure with Bicep
use_cases.description: Deploy Azure infrastructure using Bicep templates with proper RBAC configuration

use_cases.title: Set up CI/CD deployment pipeline
use_cases.description: Configure automated deployments using GitHub Actions with Azure OIDC authentication
use_cases.target_user: Platform engineers setting up deployment pipelines

prompt_templates.title: Basic Azure deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy my application to Azure using azd. The plan is already validated.

prompt_templates.title: Deploy with specific recipe
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy using the Bicep recipe. Confirm the subscription and location with me first.

prompt_templates.title: Deploy and handle errors
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy to Azure. If there are errors, check the troubleshooting guide and suggest fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Production deployment with confirmation
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to deploy to production. Run the pre-deploy checklist, confirm destructive actions, and deploy using Terraform.

output_examples.output: I need to verify the prerequisites first. Let me check if azure-prepare and azure-validate have been run...
Loading Bicep recipe... What Azure subscription and location should I use for deployment?

best_practices: Always run azure-prepare before azure-deploy to generate a valid deployment plan
Always run azure-validate before azure-deploy to catch configuration errors early
Use ask_user confirmation for destructive actions like deleting resource groups
anti_patterns: Skipping azure-validate to save time - this causes deployment failures
Manually updating the plan status to bypass validation checks
Assuming the subscription or location without confirming with the user

faq.question: What prerequisites are required before deploying?
faq.answer: You must run azure-prepare to generate .azure/plan.md, then run azure-validate to verify the plan is valid with status 'Validated'.

faq.question: Can I skip the validation step?
faq.answer: No. The skill is designed to require validation. You cannot manually set the plan status to bypass this check.

faq.question: What deployment methods are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports Azure Developer CLI (azd), Bicep templates, and Terraform. The method is specified in your deployment plan.

faq.question: How do I confirm destructive actions?
faq.answer: Use ask_user to get explicit confirmation before deleting resources, overwriting files, or making irreversible changes.

faq.question: What should I do if deployment fails?
faq.answer: Check the recipe-specific errors.md file for common issues. The troubleshooting guide has solutions for authentication, quota, and configuration errors.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes examples for GitHub Actions and Azure DevOps with OIDC authentication using service principals.
